head.supplied: Bank Buildings ¶ George Street Sydney ¶ 25th Febry 1860 ¶ Dear Sir, ¶ ¶ I am in receipt of your favor of the 19th Inst ¶ — and by todays steamer " ¶ City of Sydney ¶ " beg to forward you what I have...

div.p: MS 13071 Royal Society of Victoria Exploration Committee records, box 2077/3, La Trobe Australian Manuscripts Collection, State Library of Victoria, Melbourne.

I am in receipt of your favor of the 19th Inst
Letter not found. — and by todays steamer " City of Sydney " beg to forward you what I have left of the Parcel of Coca leaves given me by Mr Lidger
Charles Ledger? At the meeting of the Exploration Committee held on 30 May 1859, the secretary read a letter from Chas. Ledger Esq containing the offer, as a contribution to the Expedition, of 10 lbs of Coca leaves used by the Mexicans & others for warding off hunger and thirst. Thanks were voted to Mr Ledger. (Box 2088B/1, online as
[http://handle.slv.vic.gov.au/10381/163008]
. Minute book, Royal Society of Victoria, Exploration Committee, p. 27). the parcel was originally made up for the Victorian Expedition, but as they neither applied for it, nor answered my letter concerning it — the parcel was placed at my disposal by Mr Ledger — and I have made several small presents of some of its contents — the remainder I have much pleasure in forwarding to your better care

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
